summary: Significant screening disparities exist across demographic groups. Medicare patients 65-75 have 82% screening rates vs. only 48% for patients 50-55, highlighting intervention opportunities.

financial_impact.math: $165,000/year = $85,000 in quality bonus payments + $80,000 in early detection treatment margin

clinical_impact.description: Addressing demographic disparities in screening can significantly improve overall outcomes.

metrics.description: Potential improvement in 5-year survival rate for younger patients
Potential reduction in late-stage diagnoses in <55 age group
Improvement in screening equity across demographics
Additional early stage CRC cases detected annually
Lower treatment costs per patient with early detection

peer_comparison.description: Top-performing practices achieve 68% screening rates among 50-55 year olds vs. your 48%. Their success stems from targeted outreach and dedicated patient navigation.

financial_impact.math: $230,000/year = $120,000 in quality bonus payments + $110,000 in early detection treatment margin

action_steps.text: Implement age-specific outreach strategies for 50-55 cohort
Establish after-hours screening options for working adults
Generate targeted outreach lists for 50-55 age group
Implement transportation assistance for Medicaid patients
Create screening education materials for younger patients
Develop Medicaid-specific FIT test distribution program

suggestions.text: Analyze successful Medicare outreach strategies for adaptation
Consider employer partnership program for 50-55 age group
